response.overview: On August 28, 2020, mountain athlete Jeff Garmire set out to break the Colorado Trail speed record. He aimed to cover 490 miles while carrying all his food and gear, striving to complete the trail faster than anyone ever had before. It would require averaging over 50 miles per day through the heart of the Rocky Mountains. This record is the first of its kind to be captured by a film crew and showcases the highs and lows of a multi-day trail speed record.
response.title: Free Outside
